abstracts.cdata!:
This reconstruction import credit is
            intended to maintain the momentum of the present reform at
            the macroeconomic and sectoral levels, as well as providing
            critically needed financing to restore economic growth.
            Divided into three parts, the first part is designed to
            deepen the action programs for the energy, agriculture and
            industrial sectors. Second, the project would facilitate
            railway and road transport operations that provide essential
            support to the production sectors. Finally, public and
            private investment programming and management would be
            strengthened. This would also include improving the
            definition of appropriate policy response to the social
            problems linked to the period of hyperinflation and
            subsequent adjustment. In support of these cited objectives
            the project would finance priority equipment, spare parts
            and other imported inputs in the energy and agriculture
            sectors. It would also provide foreign exchange for imports
            for producers in agriculture and assist with private
            manufacturing and agro-based entities. Technical assistance
            would be provided to facilitate the restructuring of the
            railway sector.
